page.title: 05Guide dog breeding centre
page.content: The Tollgate Farm Guide for the Blind Association's breeding centre stands on 7 acres alongside the A41. This the only guide dog breeding centre in the country and consists of the farm house converted into offices and 4 kennel wings. there is one wing each for welping, bitches, stud dogs and dogs under assessment.In addition the grounds contain a dispensary, kitchen, puppy centre and fine weather grass runs. The centre employs 21 people and has a breeding stock of 200 bitches and 37 stud dogs. About 1000 puppies are born each year. Of these 51% are Labradors, 23% Golden Retrievers, 10% German Shepherds, 4% Collies with mixed breeds making up the remainder. In addition the centre acts as an assessment centre to choose those dogs suitable for training.
